title: Experiment-Based Mobile Microlearning for Understanding Assessment Learning (Self-Directed)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Psychological Learning Theories and Basic Smartphone Usage Skills
context.additional_context: An experiment-based learning environment accessible solely via smartphones, enabling simple image recognition and assessment tasks in limited technological settings

learning_goals: Learners can explain the differences between evaluative learning and classical conditioning through experiment-based assignments.
Learners can analyze the impact of stimulus competition on evaluative learning using experimental data.
Learners can assess the association between visual stimuli (geometric shapes) and emotional responses (facial expressions) presented in a mobile environment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
